panels.description: Displays how many replicas are currently running
panels.title: Available Pods

panels.description: Displays CPU average usage in cores per daemonset
panels.title: CPU Usage (damonset)

panels.description:
Displays Mem average usage in bytes per pod.

WSS/OOM:
The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,dirty memory, and kernel memory.

Usage:
Current memory usage, this includes all memory regardless of when it was accessed.

RSS:
The amount of anonymous and swap cache memory, includes transparent hugepages). Real memory pages that are currently mapped.

Cache:
Number of bytes of page cache memory.
panels.title: Mem Usage (daemonset)

panels.description: Displays CPU average usage in cores per pod
panels.title: CPU Usage (pod)

panels.description: Displays CPU average usage in cores per pod and container

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+", container!="", image!~".+pause.+"}[2m])) by (pod, container)

panels.title: CPU Usage (pod/container)

panels.description:
Displays Requests  and/or Limits per container

Guaranteed QoS: 
Every Container in the Pod must have a memory limit and a memory request, and they must be the same.Every Container in the Pod must have a CPU limit and a CPU request, and they must be the same.

Burstable Qos:
The Pod does not meet the criteria for QoS class Guaranteed.At least one Container in the Pod has a memory or CPU request

BestEffort QoS:
Pod must not have any memory or CPU limits or requests.

targets.expr: max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{resource="cpu",unit="core", cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{resource="cpu",unit="core", cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

panels.title: CPU Requests/Limits

panels.description: Displays Throttled CPU  in cores per pod and container when container is in Guaranteed QoS

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+", image!~".+pause.+"}[2m])) by (pod, container) or on() vector(0)

panels.title: CPU Throttled (pod/container)

panels.description:
Displays Mem average usage in bytes per pod.

WSS/OOM:
The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,dirty memory, and kernel memory.

Usage:
Current memory usage, this includes all memory regardless of when it was accessed.

RSS:
The amount of anonymous and swap cache memory, includes transparent hugepages). Real memory pages that are currently mapped.

Cache:
Number of bytes of page cache memory.
panels.title: Mem Usage (pod)

panels.description:
Displays Mem average usage in bytes per pod and container.

WSS/OOM:
The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,dirty memory, and kernel memory.

Usage:
Current memory usage, this includes all memory regardless of when it was accessed.

RSS:
The amount of anonymous and swap cache memory, includes transparent hugepages). Real memory pages that are currently mapped.

Cache:
Number of bytes of page cache memory.

targets.expr: sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+", container!="", image!~".+pause.+"}) by (pod, container)
sum(container_memory_usage_bytes{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+", container!="", image!~".+pause.+"}) by (pod, container)
sum(container_memory_rss{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+", container!="", image!~".+pause.+"}) by (pod, container)
sum(container_memory_cache{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+", container!="", image!~".+pause.+"}) by (pod, container)

panels.title: Mem Usage (pod/container)

panels.description:
Displays Requests  and/or Limits per container

Guaranteed QoS: 
Every Container in the Pod must have a memory limit and a memory request, and they must be the same.Every Container in the Pod must have a CPU limit and a CPU request, and they must be the same.

Burstable Qos:
The Pod does not meet the criteria for QoS class Guaranteed.At least one Container in the Pod has a memory or CPU request

BestEffort QoS:
Pod must not have any memory or CPU limits or requests.

targets.expr: max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{resource="memory",unit="byte", cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{resource="memory",unit="byte", cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$DaemonSet.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

panels.title: Mem Requests/Limits

panels.description: Displays number of memory usage hits limits
panels.title: Memory Failures

panels.description:
If pods of this DaemonSet have host network enabled, the graph represents the network traffic of the host

Check it in Cluster node > Network PODs
panels.title: Network Throughput

panels.description:
If pods of this DaemonSet have host network enabled, the graph represents the network traffic of the host

Check it in Cluster node > Network PODs
panels.title: Network Packet Rate
